intro: Pavonia erythrolema, commonly known as the scarlet pavonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bright red bracts that surround its small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Pavonia erythrolema is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
